meanings.definition: A manuscript or piece of writing material on which the original writing has been effaced to make room for later writing but of which traces remain.
meanings.sent1: The ancient library contained many palimpsests, showing layers of writing on the same parchment.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists discovered palimpsests in the ruins, revealing hidden stories from the past.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a palimpsest of clues in the old journal, each layer revealing a new mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a palimpsest, memories overlapping and fading with time.
meanings.sent5: The artist's canvas was a palimpsest of colors, each layer adding depth to the painting.

meanings.definition: Something reused or altered but still bearing visible traces of its earlier form.
meanings.sent1: The antique shop displayed various palimpsests of furniture, each piece holding a history.
meanings.sent2: The old building was a palimpsest of architectural styles, showcasing its evolution over the years.
meanings.sent3: The recipe was a palimpsest of flavors, combining traditional tastes with a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was a palimpsest of fashion trends, blending vintage pieces with contemporary styles.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a palimpsest of blooms, with flowers from different seasons blooming together.
